title: Implement the requested Shop Dashboard UI (Post Update, Open/Closed toggle, Active/Expired posts sections)

requirements.text: Update the Shop Dashboard page to match the requested simple layout by adding: (1) a primary button labeled "Post Update", (2) a toggle control to mark the shop as "Open" or "Closed", (3) a section titled "My Active Posts", and (4) a section titled "Expired Posts".

quotes:
Create Shop Dashboard with:

1. Button: "Post Update"
2. Toggle Button: Mark Shop Open / Closed
3. Section: My Active Posts
4. Section: Expired Posts

Keep layout simple and easy to use.

acceptanceCriteria: On route /shop-dashboard, the page shows a visible "Post Update" button.
On route /shop-dashboard, the page shows a toggle control with clear states "Open" and "Closed" (English text).
On route /shop-dashboard, the page shows a section labeled "My Active Posts".
On route /shop-dashboard, the page shows a section labeled "Expired Posts".
The overall layout is mobile-first, uncluttered, and easy to scan (simple vertical stacking, consistent spacing).

requirements.text: Ensure the Shop Dashboard still supports the existing shop registration/edit entrypoint: when the caller has no shop record, show a clear CTA to register; when a shop exists, allow navigating to the shop registration page to edit.
acceptanceCriteria: If no shop is returned for the current caller, the dashboard shows a clear register CTA that navigates to /shop-registration.
If a shop is returned for the current caller, the dashboard shows an edit action that navigates to /shop-registration.
These registration/edit controls do not conflict with or hide the required "Post Update", "Open/Closed" toggle, and the two posts sections.

requirements.text: For "My Active Posts" and "Expired Posts" sections, implement simple empty states (English text) when there are no items, without adding backend persistence yet.

quotes:
Section: My Active Posts
4. Section: Expired Posts

acceptanceCriteria: If there are no active posts to display, "My Active Posts" shows an empty-state message in English (e.g., "No active posts yet").
If there are no expired posts to display, "Expired Posts" shows an empty-state message in English (e.g., "No expired posts").
No backend APIs, state schema, or persistence are introduced for posts as part of this change.

constraints: Use English for all user-facing text.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose existing UI components instead).
Keep the backend as a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; do not introduce additional backend services.
nonGoals: Implementing actual post creation, storage, expiration logic, or a posts feed backed by the canister.
Persisting the Open/Closed state to the backend (unless separately requested later).
Adding product catalog, inventory management, or analytics features beyond the requested Shop Dashboard elements.
